pullRequest.body:
This defines, for convenience, a map `cfcHomSuperset : C(s, R) â†’ A` whenever `spectrum R a âŠ† s` in the natural way (i.e., by precomposition with the inclusion map).

---

This was useful for me to show that the decomposition of a selfadjoint `a = b - c` into a difference of nonnegative elements with `b * c = 0` is unique in #18138.

ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.

:v: j-loreaux can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11533933964/job/32107409331)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11533933964/job/32107409235)
Does `letI` actually do anything here (as opposed to just `let`)? I thought this was a Lean3-ism.

it has a different meaning from Lean 3. In Lean 3 it reset the instance cache since that was frozen. In Lean 4, we don't freeze the instance cache anymore, so that's not relevant, but now the `I` means "inline". I thought it would be better to inline this, but maybe it doesn't matter. I'll check before merging.
Ah I see! Yeah I forgot what it did in Lean 4; inlining certainly makes sense here.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: define `cfcHomSuperset`
